subject: Physics
chapter: Motion of Charged Particles in Magnetic Field
title: Level 3

A bead of mass \(200\,\text{g}\) is threaded on the wire and projected with speed \(1.5\times10^{5}\,\text{m s}^{-1}\). A uniform magnetic field of \(0.2\,\text{T}\) is perpendicular to the wire. In the diagram, a particle of charge \(+Q\) and mass \(M\) is projected making an angle \(\beta\) with the vertical. Above the dark line the magnetic field is \(B_1\) (out of/into page as shown) and below it is \(B_2\). Considering all possible values of \(B_1\) and \(B_2\), which shown path is possible?
A positively charged particle moves in the \(x\!-\!y\) plane initially along \(+x\). Beyond point P its path is as shown and is non-circular. Which combination of fields beyond P is possible?

A non-conducting cylindrical shell of radius \(R\) is placed in a uniform magnetic field (axis parallel to \(\vec B\)). A hole is drilled and a particle of charge \(q\) and mass \(m\) is projected with speed \(v_0\) perpendicular to \(\vec B\) directed towards the axis. The particle collides elastically with the inner wall and rebounds. Choose the correct statements.
qOptions: The minimum number of collisions after which it will emerge is two.
The maximum speed for which it can come out is \(v_0=(qBR/m)\sqrt{3}\).
The minimum time in which it can come out is \(\dfrac{\pi m}{qB}\).
If projected with speed \(v_0/3\) where \(v_0=(qBR/m)\sqrt{3}\), it will come out after five collisions.

questions.qText: In a cylindrical annular region between \(r=a\) and \(r=3a\) a uniform magnetic field \(\vec B=B_0\hat k\) exists (axis is the \(z\)-axis). A charged particle is projected from point A perpendicular to \(\vec B\) at an angle of \(37^{\circ}\) with the radially inward direction, such that during its circular motion the minimum distance from the \(z\)-axis is \(a\). Which of the following are correct?
qOptions: The particle must be negatively charged.
The particle must be positively charged.

questions.qText: Different charged particles are accelerated through the same potential difference and then enter a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to their velocities, moving in circular paths. Choose the correct statements.
qOptions: All particles have the same kinetic energy.
For the same mass-to-charge ratio, the radii of circular paths are the same.
If the magnetic field is doubled, the radii become half.
Singly-charged ionised isotopes will have different radii.

questions.qText: A ring of mass \(m\) and radius \(R\) rolls without slipping on a horizontal rough surface in a uniform magnetic field \(B\) (as shown). A point charge \(q\) of negligible mass is attached to the ring. (\(\theta\) is measured clockwise from the positive \(y\)-axis.) Choose the correct statements.
qOptions: The ring continues to move with constant velocity.
The friction on the ring is \(Bqv\cos\theta\).
The friction on the ring is \(Bqv\sin\theta\).
The ring will lose contact with the ground if \(v>\dfrac{mg}{2qB}\).

questions.qText: A charged particle (charge-to-mass ratio \(\beta\)) performs conical pendulum motion with string length \(L\), angle \(\theta\) with the vertical and angular velocity \(\omega\) in uniform gravity and a vertical downward uniform magnetic field \(\vec B\). Choose the correct statements.
qOptions: The angular momentum of the particle about the suspension point remains constant.
If the direction of \(\vec B\) is reversed keeping \(\omega\) and \(L\) the same, \(\theta\) remains unchanged.
The rate of change of angular momentum about the suspension point is not a constant vector.

questions.qText: A particle of charge 1 C and mass 1 kg enters a region having uniform magnetic field of strength 2 T with speed 12 m/s as shown. Choose the correct statement(s).
qOptions: The time for which the charge remains in the magnetic field is \(\dfrac{4\pi}{3}\) s.
The velocity becomes parallel/antiparallel to the \(x\)-axis six times during its motion.
The distance between the entry and exit points is 6 m.
The deviation of the particle when it emerges is \(\dfrac{4\pi}{3}\) rad anticlockwise.

A ring of mass \(m\) and radius \(r\) (insulating, uniformly charged) moves on a frictionless horizontal table with its plane vertical. On entering completely into a region of uniform magnetic field, it starts rolling. If the charge on the ring is \(\dfrac{\sqrt{N}mv_0}{rB}\), find \(N\).

A small ball of mass \(m\) carrying charge \(+Q\) is dropped in a uniform horizontal magnetic field \(B\). The vertical depth of the deepest point of its path from the initial position is \(\dfrac{(3k-1)m^2 g}{Q^2 B^2}\). Find \(k\). (Take uniform gravity vertically downward.)

A particle with specific charge \(\sigma\) is projected in the \(xy\)-plane with speed \(v\). A uniform magnetic field of magnitude \(B_0\) exists along the \(z\)-direction and reverses its direction after every interval \(\dfrac{2\pi}{\sigma B_0}\). Calculate the maximum separation (in metres) between two positions of the particle during its motion. (Given \(\dfrac{v}{\sigma B_0}=2\,\text{m}\). Neglect gravity and other forces.)
